Samuel Warmack (1899 – death unknown) was an American Negro league outfielder between 1922 and 1933.
Early life and career
Warmack made his Negro leagues debut in 1922 for the Richmond Giants. He played for the Hilldale Club in 1929, the Washington Pilots in 1932, and finished his career with the Bacharach Giants in 1932 and 1933.
References
Further reading

* Afro-American staff (July 6, 1929). [https://www.mediafire.com/view/c9o3oy35abpn093 "Black Sox Sign Two New Players"]. Baltimore Afro-American. p. 15
* Post-Star staff (June 24, 1931). [https://www.newspapers.com/clip/81850783/the-post-star/ "Clintons to Meet Local Nine Today; Schenectady Club to Sub for Mohawk Giants; Four Players of Latter Injured"] The Glen Falls Post-Star. p. 9
